result.execSummary:
The defendant Colleen Joy Eide was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Colleen Joy Eide is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Colleen Joy Eide was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Bail continues until Defendant is signed up for Probation.
Court does not object to release of Defendant's property.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF62.
Court waives DNA surcharge.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random testing as deemed necessary by Agent.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY:  Brian Thomas Smestad, DF:  Colleen Joy Eide appeared. There is an agreement. Court reviews felony conviction consequences and constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for the AMENDED count one (961.41(3g)(g) - Class I felony).  Def pleads guilty. Court uses complaints/reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of count 1, as AMENDED. Count 2 is dismissed. Court orders -  S/W; 3 years probation with conditions:
- Court costs of $268.00; payable through probation 
- AODA and follow through with all recommendations
- Absolute sobriety:  As it relates to controlled substances; zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random testing, as deemed necessary by probation agent. 
Bail continues until def is signed up for probation. Court does not object to release of def property. 
Def is advised of right to appeal.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 28, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Matthew L Hartung, DF ATTY:  Brian T Smestad, DF:  Colleen Joy Eide appeared. Attorney Smestad requests a plea date and specific items seized to be returned. Court approves and orders items (Military ID and 3 social security cards to be returned) requested to be returned. Bond continues. Address on bond is correct however, mail is to be sent to her daughters residence.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Colleen Joy Eide
Current: 410 Hallam Ave, Mahtomedi, MN 55115 United States  (Effective: 06-30-2014)
Prior: 637 S. 13th St., #29, Hudson, WI 54016
Pre-trial conference on June 30, 2014 at 04:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Matthew L Hartung for Amber Hahn,  DF ATTY:  Brian T Smestad, DF:  Colleen Joy Eide appeared. ADA Hartung requests a new date to allow time to review a report. Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Eric G Johnson,  DF ATTY:  Brian T Smestad,  DF:  Colleen Joy Eide appeared. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands. Not Guilty plea on both counts.  Speedy trial is waived. Address is confirmed and bond continues. Atty Smestad requests a bond modification re: cost of UA testing. Court does not modify bond at this time. Defendant will keep track of UA expense. sf  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Address is confirmed and bond continues. sf  Arraignment scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Preliminary hearing on March 3, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.  

Report every Wednesday and Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.
Defendant to test today, 2/11/14 to take the place of 2/12/14; for this week only.   

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.
